thread.title: Roanoke gets SPHL franchise - News Sentinel
thread.title_full: Roanoke gets SPHL franchise - News Sentinel Story

author: News Sentinel staff
title: Roanoke gets SPHL franchise - News Sentinel
text:
The Southern Professional Hockey League announced Tuesday the move of the Mississippi Surge to Roanoke, Va., and will begin play for the 2016-17 season.
SPHL president Jim Combs said the league's board of governors approved the move last week.
"There is a strong fan base for hockey here in Roanoke and the SPHL is the best kept secret in hockey," majority owner Bob McGinn said in a SPHL release. "We have a city and a league that wants us and we definitely want to be in Roanoke. Our five local owners were a must-have to complete our business plan and my family and I can't wait to drop the puck."
The Surge, based in Biloxi, Miss., won the President's Cup in 2011. The Mississippi Coast Coliseum was a big venue to fill and the Surge folded on May 2, 2014.
The SPHL begins its 12th season on Friday with nine teams, including the Knoxville Ice Bears.
